English: Zoning Adjuster
Allows zoning of 8- and 24- meter wide roads to align with regular-width roads and adds the ability to offset zoning start positions along roads.
Disable zoning
Force zoning
Disable all zone creation when building roads (zoning can still be added using the Zoning Adjuster tool)
Prioritize older roads
Zoning attached to newer roads won't overwrite zoning attached to older roads
Prioritize newer roads
Zoning attached to older roads won't overwrite zoning attached to newer roads
No priority
Default game behavior
Zoning setback
Adds a gap between the road edge and the zoning grid
Zoning depth
Sets the maximim depth of zones (away from the road) in cells
Modifier key
Zoning offset modifier key
Panel visibility options
Automatically show zoning settings panel when the roads menu is open
Show legacy panel button
Panel and button locations
Reset panel position
Reset button position

Press any key

This means that the mod is not able to operate and has shut down.
column3: Warning message letting the user know that the mod can't work.

English: Zoning Adjuster was unable to complete its required Harmony patches.
column3: Warning message that a patching problem was detected, and the mod can't operate.

English: Possible causes of this problem include:
column3: Header for list of possible causes of Harmony errors.

English: The required Harmony 2 mod dependency was not installed
column3: Possible cause of Harmony error - Harmony not installed.

English: An old and/or broken mod is preventing Harmony 2 from operating properly
column3: Possible cause of Harmony error - a broken mod (not this one) can cause things to stop working.

English: Another mod may be trying to apply a conflicting Harmony patch
column3: Possible cause of Harmony error - two mods trying to patch the same thing at once.

English: Mod conflict detected!
column3: Warning message that a mod conflict was detected.

English: The conflicting mods are:
column3: Part of the mod conflict warning notification - header for the list of conflicting mods.

English: These mods must be removed before Zoning Adjuster can operate.
New zoning tool for adding, resetting, and removing zoning for any road
Zoning tool option: variable zoning setback from road
Zoning tool option: prioritize zoning by age of road (so zoning for new roads doesn't disrupt zoning attached to existing roads)
Add option to prioritize zoning of newer roads
Each newly-created zone block now remembers the priority settings it was created with (i.e. prioritizing newer or older roads) and will retain that priority regardless of any setting changes
NOTE 1: this only applies to newly-created zone blocks
NOTE 2: conflicting settings (e.g. a newer road prioritizing older settings next to an older road prioritizing newer settings) will lead to inconsistent results
Tool button is now moveable (click and drag to move)
Button and panel positions are saved when exiting the game
Add option to show/hide settings panel by default when road menu is visible
Add 'disable zoning' option to disable all automatic zoning (zoning can still be applied manually using the Zoning Adjuster tool)
Add 'force zoning' option to add zoning on construction to roads without zoning enabled (e.g. highways)
Add option to toggle single-side zoning (hold Alt key when clicking with the Zoning Adjuster tool)
Allow negative zoning setback (move zoning closer to the road)
Add zoning tool hotkey (default Alt-Z)
Add adjustable zone depth
Add option to disable panel button (the Unified UI button is always available)
Compatiblility with game version 1.15 (Plazas & Promenades)
